text: Patient: Michael Scott (DOB: 03/15/1964). Presenting with chest pain radiating to the left arm. BP 160/95. History of hypertension. Prescribed Lisinopril 10mg daily.
Patient: Dwight Schrute. Complains of sudden onset migraines with aura. Sensitivity to beets... I mean light. No nausea. CT scan was clear. Recommended rest and hydration.
Patient: Jim Halpert. 28yo male. Sore throat and fever of 101F for 2 days. Strep test positive. Prescribed Amoxicillin 500mg TID for 10 days.
Patient: Stanley Hudson. Chronic back pain, specifically lumbar region. Pain level 7/10. Difficulty sitting for long periods. MRI shows herniated disc L4-L5. Referral to PT.
Patient: Kelly Kapoor. Reports high anxiety and racing thoughts. Difficulty sleeping. Denies suicidal ideation. Started on Sertraline 50mg.
